title: Windlesham Arboretum Walking Route

images.title: raydar / Windlesham Arboretum
images.caption: Windlesham Arboretum. View of the arboretum and one of its many follies. A beautiful area to walk and contemplate at your leisure.

images.title: raydar / Windlesham Arboretum
images.caption: Photo of the small chapel at the site.

images.title: raydar / Windlesham Arboretum, entrance to Chapel
images.caption: Lovely leafy archway entrance to the chapel.

description: This short walk explores the lovely Windlesham Arboretum in Surrey. Here you'll find a series of nice woodland trails, small lakes, monuments, follies, a small chapel and several thousand rare trees. You can access the site at South Farm Lane where you can pick up a series of public footpaths around the woods and the ponds. Head a short distance west of the site and you can visit Lightwater Country Park. There's more nice trails here with 145 acres of heathland habitat, woodland and hill climbs with views towards the city of London.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The site is located near the Camberley Walk where you can visit Swinley Forest, Bracknell Forest and the Tri Lakes Country Park. There's miles of good woodland and waterside trails on this splendid route. For more walking ideas in the area see the Surrey Walks page.

display_address: South Farm Lane, Lightwater, Windlesham, Bagshot, Surrey Heath, Surrey, England, GU19 5PA, United Kingdom
